Você leva muito tempo para tentar pegar o pequeno inseto. Você finalmente se aproxima do coelho e tenta agarrá-lo. No último segundo, ele faz sua dancinha estranha para que você erre, e você tropeça e cai de bruços em uma cascavel que te morde no olho antes de deslizar para longe.

It takes you a long time to try to catch the little bugger.
You finally approach the bunny and try to grab it. At the last second, it begins its odd little dance, but you are ready for such twists and you nab it and put it into a basket.
You hear grateful howls from afar.

You figure out that an odd turn of fate creates a distraction mere seconds before the creature is to be taken. Once you know the pattern, it is easier to work around it.
You finally approach the bunny and try to grab it. At the last second, it begins its odd little dance, but you are ready for such twists and you nab it and put it into a basket.
You hear grateful howls from afar.
You have no idea what is going on here.
Você dá um soco no coelho, mas perde o equilíbrio no último minuto e bate em si mesmo. Eventualmente, você consegue o pequeno bugger, mas não foi uma tarefa fácil.

Você mata a maior parte do bando, mas outros escapam e o observam de longe, como se estivessem esperando para ver alguma coisa. Então você vê uma pequena clareira onde um coelho branco está pastando. Ao redor você vê esquisitices, armadilhas quebradas e pedaços de pele de lobo. Há um lobo morto debaixo de uma pedra que deve ter caído do céu. O coelho ocasionalmente para de pastar e começa a dançar e cantarolar uma música. Então ele para e come novamente.
Os lobos batem em você, mas parecem exaustos demais para perseguir você. Na verdade, um deles aponta na direção do coelho que você veio encontrar.

Você vê uma pequena clareira onde um coelho branco está pastando. Ao redor você vê esquisitices, armadilhas quebradas e pedaços de pele de lobo. Há um lobo morto debaixo de uma pedra que deve ter caído do céu. O coelho ocasionalmente para de pastar e começa a dançar e cantarolar uma música. Então ele para e come novamente.

Adventure.name: Bunny 2
Adventure.nodes: Você segue o rastro do coelho perdido e se depara com uma grande mansão onde um velho o cumprimenta. Ele se senta à beira de um lago em seu jardim, cercado por vários rusalka que o servem. Todas as mulheres têm orelhas de coelho grosseiramente costuradas em suas testas e caudas de coelho presas às suas nádegas.

Eles se voltam para você e sussurram: 'Estamos livres das regras da água, mas como você bem sabe, nossa natureza ordena que sigamos outra. Este mestre é estranho, é verdade, mas aqui é divertido e nós gostamos.
'Oh sim. Uma esquisitice de que o velho gosta. A maneira como eles falam com você parece estranha, e você suspeita que essas partes de coelho estão encantadas.
Você mata o homem e alguns de seus 'coelhos'. Aqueles que vivem parecem chocados e perdidos. Eles rapidamente mergulham no lago. Infelizmente, você não encontra nenhum coelho vivo.
You are badly beaten and forced to flee. If you try to return, the house is gone.

'Receio que os únicos coelhinhos pulando são meus amores. Aqui, tome uma bebida por minha conta. Mas posso vender-te este cabrito branco - parece um coelhinho. A princípio, quase pensei que fosse, por isso estar aqui comigo.
'Why, I never could say no to a pretty face. Here, take it and have fun.'
'Please vacate my premises. You are spoiling my view of the bunnies.'

You free the rusalka and they immediately attack the old man, ripping him into shreds and drowning his bloody carcass in the lake.
One turns to you:
'Thank you. We do not have any live bunnies for you, but here, take this goat - it looks a bit like a bunny. Maybe your man will take it.'
You fail to defeat the rusalka and are forced to run. If you try to return, the house is gone.

Adventure.name: Bunny Man 2
Adventure.nodes:
The bunny man, Tobiasz, finds you on your way back:
'You found him! Thank you, thank you so much. I shall come with you and be at your service from now on. Oh, and Radzio gave me this gift for you, said to tell you thanks and good luck. Whatever does he mean, odd child...?'
'What, but...why? Bring him to me, then I will come with you.'

Adventure.name: Bunny Man 3
Adventure.nodes:
The bunny man, Tobiasz, finds you on your way back. He is accompanied by a friend:
'You found him?'
He looks at you suspiciously.
'What, but...why? Bring him to me, then I will come with you.'

'Oh, well, fair enough. We are reunited, Nala!
'Now, I shall join you. Oh, and Radzio gave me this gift for you, said to tell you thanks and good luck. Whatever does he mean, odd child...?'
'Não, não, pessoas más...' Ele sai correndo perturbado.

Adventure.name: Bunny 3
Adventure.nodes:
You find the place where you should look for the lost bunny, but you find a group of armour-clad warriors standing outside a cave, arguing.
'You go in now.' 'No, you.' 'We should just leave.' 'It is our duty to -' 'Oh, just shut up with the duty.'

Os lutadores armados se voltam para você, armas em punho, mas não sacadas: 'O coelho? Você deve estar brincando, certo? Estamos tentando matar o pequeno por dias. Ele guarda a entrada de um tesouro que procuramos.

'Let us not do the whole "a bunny, you must be kidding" - the thing is obviously enchanted or something. Unfortunately, one of its first victims was our wise one, so we're stuck. Say, if you help us get rid of it, we'll share the treasure, eh?'

'The way we see it, we have two choices. Our zerca was a follower of Svarog, and he made this sun artefact that is said to cleanse any darkness from any creature. But it needs a very specific activation, and, well, we do not know what it is on account of the man dying before he told us. If you do it wrong, the sun will burn us all.'

'A segunda seria todos nós trabalhando juntos. Você vai distrair o pequeno inseto, talvez até mesmo pegá-lo para o dono, se quiser, e nós entramos para pegar o tesouro. Aparentemente, uma vez que o tesouro seja pego, qualquer magia irá desmoronar, então talvez seu coelho volte ao normal novamente.'
'Tem certeza? Não terminou bem para nós. Eles ficam de lado, mas você vê os cadáveres de homens e um coelhinho branco pastando neles.
The bunny tears into you as if you were a puppet, its beady black eyes glistening with joy as your blood splatters its snowy fur.
The bunny bites and tears at your flesh. It is too small and too fast - your numbers help you to stay alive but not to kill it.

This bunny is possessed by a particularly nasty bies. Perhaps even more than one. They are all bound to an object inside the cave.
You can try to take the bies out of the bunny, then attack the creatures as it will no longer be as deadly.
Or you can attempt a ritual to banish the bies, but it will be tough.

The bies are defeated and the bunny is its normal self again. The warriors look at you with respect:
'Now that is what we call professional. Here, your share of the treasure, rightfully earned. May the sun god keep you safe.'
They move out.
You defeat the warriors and claim their part of the treasure, but it turns out the only thing they took from the chest was a ring, one of little value as far as you can tell.
The warriors defeat you but leave you alive and do not even take back the treasure they gave you. They simply leave in silence.

You are defeated and the white bunny dies in the fight too.
The other warriors eventually kill the bies. One of them comes over:
'You fought well and gave us the opportunity to take what we came here for. Here is a small reward. I am sorry your animal died.'
They depart.

Your ritual banishes the bies from this place and the bunny is its normal self again. The warriors look at you with respect:
'Now that is what we call professional. Here, your share of the treasure, rightfully earned. May the sun god keep you safe.'
They move out.

Your ritual fails and the white bunny attacks you. The warriors use you as bait and manage to kill it.
The other warriors eventually kill the bies. One of them comes over:
'You fought well and gave us the opportunity to take what we came here for. Here is a small reward. I am sorry your animal died.'
They depart.
Eles apresentam a você um objeto circular, feito à mão em mithril e matéria pura. Você precisa sussurrar o número certo para que funcione corretamente.

You whisper the number and throw the ball. In three heartbeats it opens up and a blinding, divine light washes over you all. The bunny is cleansed and you feel replenished too.
'Now that is what we call professional. Here, your share of the treasure, rightfully earned. May the sun god keep you safe.'
They move out.

You whisper the number and throw the ball. In three heartbeats it opens up and a blinding, divine light washes over you all. The bunny is cleansed and you feel replenished too.
'Now that is what we call professional. Here, your share of the treasure, rightfully earned. May the sun god keep you safe.'
They move out.

You call out to your domain and throw the ball. In three heartbeats it opens up and a blinding, divine light washes over you all. The bunny is cleansed and you feel replenished too.
'Now that is what we call professional. Here, your share of the treasure, rightfully earned. May the sun god keep you safe.'
They move out.
The orb explodes and kills the bunny and the warriors and almost kills you. Your divine connection is likely the only reason you are alive. There is no treasure to be found, only ashes.

You manage to fool the bunny long enough for the warriors to break the spell. The bunny is its normal self again. The warriors look at you with respect:
'Now that is what we call professional. Here, your share of the treasure, rightfully earned. May the sun god keep you safe.'
They move out.

You did a good job as bait, but not without some severe wounds. To save your life, the warriors had to kill the rabbit, and they lost more men:
'You fought well and gave us the opportunity to take what we came here for. Here is a small reward. I am sorry your animal died.'
They depart.

Adventure.name: Dwarf baker2
Adventure.nodes: 'You found it yet? No? Go away...'
'Ah, ya got it, great. Give it quick, I'll take it back myself. Here, a reward as promised! Metal and stone to ya, laddie. Oh, and I marked a spot for some good mining for ya too.'
